title: Iraq crisis: US deploys special forces to assess Mt Sinjar rescue mission â live | World news | The Guardian
summary: us ground troops land on mt sinjar .
british sas soldiers deployed to iraq .
white house will not rule out rescue mission involving troops .
khamenei : no talks with us except on nuclear issues .
maliki rejects appointment of new pm .

text: we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the day .
here 's a summary of where things stand : a major international military effort was under way to address the humanitarian crisis involving members of the yazidi religious minority stranded on mt .
sinjar .
the united states landed marines and special forces units on mt .
sinjar and britain deployed sas soldiers to the area .
they were said to be assessing options for a rescue mission .
the us said it had conducted a drone strike on an isis armed vehicle west of sinjar .
the european powers announced their participation in a us-organized effort to supply kurdish forces fighting militants under the banner of an islamic state with weapons .
france said it would arm the kurds directly .
the kurds called for more weapons , saying they were outgunned by is fighters .
nouri al-maliki said that the nomination of his would-be successor was unconstitutional , that he had appealed the move in court and that the country must wait for the decision and abide by it .
iraq 's humanitarian crisis deepened , with 1.5m people now internally displaced , according to the united nations , which declared a level 3 emergency in the country , its most dire warning .
a suicide bomber blew himself up at a checkpoint leading to abadi 's home in baghdad , police said .

iraq analyst sajad jiyad translates parts of maliki 's televised speech earlier today : sajad jiyad ø³ø¬ø§ø¯ ( @ sajadjiyad ) the following tweets are selections from outgoing iraqi pm maliki 's weekly address earlier today here : [ ar ] jiyad 's translation proceeds : maliki : i was at the funeral procession of air force gen. majid who sacrificed his life in a helicopter crash whiled on duty saving lives the political crisis we are in may look simple but consequences are grave & attacks foundations of democratic/constitutional state why the persistence as some ask ?

1st in defence of voters who went to elections in difficult conditions hoping for best candidate 2nd we persist until the end to defend the state , that 's why we refer to supreme court and reject constitutional violations this govt will continue & will not change until there is a ruling from the supreme court .

it 's a conspiracy to violate constitution we can not submit to this , we persist in order to respect the state & keep it on the constitutional path if we remain silent then the weak & strong will violate constitution .
if president violates constitution then how will citizens not ?

i 'm surprised at democratic states that want to fashion democracy in a way that suits them & support violators of constitution us is the leader of democracy , how did all its institutions support the ( iraqi ) president to violate the constitution ?

we persist to defend & keep respect for the supreme court , which must be submitted to and is the final arbitrator having differences is normal & so it is civilised to go to arbitrator , that is why we have gone to the supreme court we have all agreed to follow the supreme court , and now all must accept what the court decides if the decisions of the supreme court are not adhered to this will be a big danger , and will encourage others to not follow the law so we will defend the court , the constitution , and all instruments of the state , to set the political process on a correct course fighting terrorism requires a stable state , violating the constitution will weaken this fight & busy the state in internal disputes we persist against foreign states who interfere in our constitutional mechanisms .

i wo n't name states who caused all iraq 's problems i ask citizens to continue denouncing violation of the constitution , to show that there is an attempt to destroy democracy in iraq i say to political parties they must not allow political process to be destroyed by constitutional violations , that they reject them i said to military commanders to continue fight against terrorism & leave political dispute to be solved by the people what has happened politically is not less disastrous and dangerous than what happened in mosul reidar visser ( @ reidarvisser ) fought my way through weekly address by iraq 's maliki .
it mentions `` constitution '' 31 times and `` supr court '' 20 times

stars and stripes reports that the united states has moved mv-22 osprey troop transports to northern iraq : the ospreys were used tuesday to move 129 additional u.s. military personnel to the city of irbil and they remain in the area , pentagon spokesman col. steve warren told reporters on wednesday .
they 'll stay there until they 're no longer required , warren said .
warren did not say how many ospreys are there , but a defense official told stars and stripes that it 's a small number .
read the full piece here .

maliki 's dawa party on wednesday called on iraqi politicians to work with abadi to form a new government , reuters reports : in a statement , the dawa party said it called on political blocs to cooperate with the constitutionally designated prime minister , mr. abadi , and accelerate the formation of a government in the defined time period .

documents.title: british sas soldiers deployed to iraq
text: british sas soldiers have been deployed to northern iraq to gather intelligence ahead of a complex rescue operation , led by the us , to help up to 30,000 yazidi refugees off mount sinjar , the guardian reports : in the most dramatic sign of britain 's growing involvement in the iraqi crisis , the sas soldiers have moved to the region near mount sinjar where us special forces are coordinating the rescue effort .

the us , supported by the british military , is expected to take its time planning the rescue operation over the coming days to avoid a repeat of the crash of an overladen iraqi helicopter on tuesday as it airlifted refugees .
read the full piece here .

the netherlands contributes supplies toward an australian air drop in the sinjar mountains : karel van oosterom ( @ kvanoosterom ) # netherlands contributes goods to be air dropped by # australian airforce at # sinjar # iraq

a us drone strike , likely by a predator drone , four hours ago destroyed an isis armed vehicle west of sinjar , said to be near an isis checkpoint , guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) reports , drawing on a notification from centcom .
the last two strikes now have been around sinjar , rather than irbil , spencer notes ; sinjar seems to be the concentration point of us attention .

germany is prepared to bend its restrictive policies on weapons exports and arm kurdish fighters battling islamic state militants in northern iraq , foreign minister frank-walter steinmeier said on wednesday , reuters reports : the comments to german public broadcaster zdf are the strongest yet by a senior german official and represent a wholesale shift in berlin 's stance since the beginning of the week .
on monday chancellor angela merkel 's spokesman said germany was committed to upholding its position of not sending arms to conflict zones .
we can not just leave kurdistan on its own and watch as people are slaughtered there , said steinmeier , a social democrat ( spd ) whose party shares power with merkel 's conservatives .
if necessary , if the current threat level persists , i can not rule out that we will have to deliver weapons , he added .
our principles on delivering arms are exactly that , principles .
they take into account that we can have extraordinary situations in which a political decision must be made to take a different approach that is in our own security interests .

the un security council on wednesday called the nomination of haider al-abadi as iraqi prime minister an important step toward creating an inclusive government , reuters reports : in a statement , the 15-member council urged al-abadi to work swiftly to form such a government as quickly as possible and within the constitutional time-frame and called on all political parties and their supporters to remain calm and respect the political process governed by the constitution .

documents.title: un : iraq 's displaced a 'level 3 emergency '
text: the united nations on wednesday called its highest level of emergency for the humanitarian crisis in iraq , where hundreds of thousands have been driven from their homes and tens of thousands have been trapped in a desert mountain by the advance of islamic militants across the north of the country , the associated press reports : the declaration of a level 3 emergency will trigger trigger additional goods , funds and assets to respond to the needs of those displaced , said u.n. special representative nickolay mladenov , who pointed to the scale and complexity of the current humanitarian catastrophe .
since june , iraq has been facing an onslaught by the islamic state group and allied sunni militants across much of the country 's north and west .

in recent weeks , the crisis has worsened as the militant fighters swept over new towns in the north , displacing members of the minority christian and yazidi religious communities , and threatening the neighboring iraqi kurdish autonomy zone .
tens of thousands of yazidis fled the advance to take refuge in the remote desert sinjar mountain range , becoming trapped for days without food or water .

the u.s. and iraqi military have dropped food and water supplies into the mountains , and in recent days kurds from neighboring syria battled to open a corridor to the mountain , allowing some 45,000 to escape .

documents.title: us ground troops land on mt sinjar
text: a team of us marines and special forces landed on mount sinjar in iraq on wednesday to assess options for rescuing yazidi civilians threatened by islamic extremists and worn down by hunger and thirst , the guardian reports : the forces flew in on v-22 osprey tilt-rotor aircraft that can land vertically .
they joined a small number of american special forces who , the guardian has been told , had been on the mountain for some days .
that team had been assessing the military and humanitarian situation and guiding us air strikes against islamic state ( isis ) fighters encircling the mountain .
a handful of british sas soldiers were also in the area to gather intelligence , a british official said .
the developments were the first confirmation that international forces were on mount sinjar .
fleeing yazidis have reported seeing small teams of american soldiers high on the northern flank .
we were n't allowed to go near them , said a man from sinjar who was airlifted from the former base .
they were being guarded by the kurds .
read the full piece here .
note : this post has been updated to reflect advice by the us government that us forces at mt sinjar are currently engaged in a reconnaissance mission that does not yet qualify as a rescue mission .
iraq is n't just fighting a local issue for itself if the islamic state further entrenches itself then it will be very difficult to dislodge , iraqi analyst sajad jiyad tells the bbc .
so now is the time for action .
jiyad lays out a six-point plan for action : sajad jiyad ø³ø¬ø§ø¯ ( @ sajadjiyad ) my comments on the bbc today about international intervention in iraq & a 6 point action plan to resolve the crisis

video : aftermath of iraqi helicopter crash in sinjar mountains footage shows the aftermath of an iraqi army helicopter crash in the sinjar mountains , in which the pilot was killed and three journalists injured .
the russian-made mi-17 helicopter crashed on tuesday while delivering aid to yazidi refugees trapped on the mountainside .
vian dakhil , a yazidi member of iraq 's parliament , was also among those onboard .

the united states is organizing the activities of france , britain and germany to arm kurds in iraq , reuters reports , citing an unnamed official : the american diplomatic outreach underlines a preference in washington to work within an international coalition to help the kurds as they fend off the onslaught from the radical sunni islamists who have captured large areas of northwest iraq .

the czech government is looking for ways to supply weapons to the kurds , possibly through private companies , czech foreign minister lubomir zaoralek was quoted by local newspaper hospodarske noviny as saying on wednesday .
an italian government official said the push to supply military aid to the kurds is coming from the americans , but also the kurds themselves .
the british are pushing a lot , too .
mitchell prothero ( @ mitchprothero ) hagel : `` this is not a combat boots on the ground kind of operation . ''
[ everyone knows jsoc types wear merrells in the field ] h/t @ twitterid
the guardian 's raya jalabi ( @ rayajalabi ) has taken a closer look at maliki 's attempt to delay his exit from the prime minister 's office .

first raya explains how maliki lost the parliamentary fight that produced haider al-abadi 's nomination as prime minister : on monday , the national alliance ( a coalition of electoral blocs , including the state of law bloc , formed the day before the current parliamentary session ) nominated haider al-abadi to be prime minister , which abadi accepted .
later in the day , this was confirmed by presidential decree .
abadi is a member of maliki 's dawa party , making this move tantamount to an internal revolt .
abadi reportedly received 127 votes from members of the national alliance including almost half of maliki 's state of law bloc members .
significantly , 38 votes came from maliki 's dawa party .
these dissenting votes effectively caused the rupture of the state of law bloc and the dawa party .

in his rejection of this process , maliki is pointing to a 2010 court decision : maliki 's appeal rests on a decision made in 2010 by the federal court , which stated that the largest bloc ( whether electoral or parliamentary ) should be tasked with forming the government , and more specifically , the largest bloc upon the first meeting of parliament .
but these blocs have been shifting .
behind the scenes , maliki and his opponents are arguing about the timing of the shifts and who was in charge when .
maliki 's state of law bloc is technically the largest .
until monday , maliki could have rightfully claimed that he should have been tasked with forming the government , since he was the leader of the april election 's biggest winning group .

however , the fragmentation of the state of law bloc and the formation of the national alliance has meant that maliki 's claim to represent the biggest group at the start of the first parliamentary session is no longer true .
read the full piece here .

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : the white house said the us is considering using troops to establish a humanitarian corridor to evacuate yazidis from the sinjar mountains .
a spokesman said it would not constitute a combat mission and there would be a limited military objective .
iraqi prime minister nouri al-maliki said in a televised address that the nomination of haider al-abadi to replace him was a violation of the constitution and had no value .
france said it would send arms directly to iraqi kurdish forces fighting islamist militants .
britain said it would help fly weapons from eastern europe to the kurds .
the united states also is arming the kurds .
air drops of food and supplies continued in the sinjar mountains , where thousands of yazidis were still stranded .
officials warned much more help was needed .
a suicide bomber blew himself up at a checkpoint leading to abadi 's home in baghdad , police said .
there was no word of casualties .

the obama administration was forced to defend itself against accusations of mission creep after admitting that one of the main options in iraq under consideration is a direct role for us forces in creating a humanitarian corridor for the evacuation of people stranded in the sinjar mountains , guardian washington bureau chief dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) reports : [ the president ] is open to recommendations in which the united states is helping to facilitate the removal of these people from the mountain , said deputy spokesman eric schultz .
if there are additional things we can do as part of an effort to move people off the mountain he will certainly review those options , he added .

pressed on whether this would contradict obama 's promise to avoid a combat role for us ground troops if this evacuation mission came under attack , schultz added : there are dangers involved in any military operation but [ the president ] is confident that we can have a limited military objective .
read the full piece here .

a kurdish peshmerga fighter has described to reuters how his forces were overwhelmed in their fight with the islamic state militants : the kurdish peshmerga fighter ran out of ammunition but saved two bullets to end his own life in case islamic state militants caught up with him as he fled the front line in northwest iraq .

after a two-month stand-off along a 1,000-kilometre ( 630 mile ) long front , the kurds failed their first major test , allowing the sunni militants who want to redraw the map of the middle east to grab more towns , oil fields and iraq 's biggest dam .

the peshmerga , literally those who confront death , had built up a reputation as fearsome warriors , but in the end they proved no match for the better-armed militants who attacked them with suicidal zeal .
they took us by surprise , said the peshmerga fighter , who asked to remain unnamed because the force had been ordered not to divulge any information about their defeat .
for every mortar round we fired , they fired 100 back .
we did n't know where they were coming from .
we lost contact with each other .
we did n't have enough weapons .
it was chaos , he told reuters .
read the full piece here .
the guardian 's nicholas watt and rajeev syal have more on british assistance in transporting soviet-era ammunition from eastern european countries to kurdish forces .

uk prime minister david cameron announced the operation on wednesday : in a sign of britain 's growing involvement in iraq , the prime minister also confirmed that british forces would also play a leading role in airlifting yazidi refugees from mount sinjar .
chinook helicopters deployed to the region are expected to join a us-led operation in the coming days to airlift the refugees .
the raf will be flying in soviet-era weapons from former warsaw pact countries in eastern europe to the kurds who are trained in the use of weapons which originated from the soviet union .
the kurds have not requested british weapons .
from downing street , cameron told the bbc : we do support the kurds and we should continue to support the kurds .
in terms of the ammunition they are getting britain is going to be playing a role in helping to get that to them .
what they want is ammunition and weapons like they have been using .
that is what is being delivered to them and britain is playing a role in helping to make sure that happens .
read the full piece here .
here 's video from cameron 's statement : david cameron says britain will help to transport ammunition and arms to kurdish forces on the ground in iraq , but will not supply weapons directly .
the prime minister says british forces will also be involved in a plan to rescue thousands of yazidis trapped on the mountainside in sinjar , but would not be drawn on the specific role .

documents.title: white house will not rule out rescue mission involving troops
text: us president barack obama has ruled out using american troops for combat in iraq , but he is weighing potential options to help provide humanitarian assistance to stranded iraqis , white house deputy national security adviser ben rhodes said in a briefing on martha 's vineyard , where obama is vacationing .
rhodes declined to rule out the possibility of using u.s. forces on the ground in a humanitarian role , reuters reports .

deputy national security adviser for strategic communications and speechwriting , ben rhodes , speaks during a news briefing in edgartown , mass. , on the island of martha 's vineyard , wednesday , aug. 13 , 2014 .
senne/ap obama will make a decision within days about whether to send the us military to rescue iraqi refugees trapped on a mountain , according to an ap account of rhodes ' briefing .
rhodes says obama will receive recommendations from a pentagon team that 's gone to northern iraq to assess the situation .
rhodes says the u.s. could coordinate a rescue mission with kurdish forces as well as allies such as britain .
rhodes also said maliki should respect the political process and let it move forward .

here are further remarks from the television appearance in which maliki rejected the nomination of abadi as his replacement , via the associate press : holding on ( to the premiership ) is an ethical and patriotic duty to defend the rights of voters , al-maliki said wednesday in his weekly address to the nation , insisting his actions were meant to protect the state .
al-maliki on monday vowed legal action , saying he would go to the courts to prove the president 's choice of al-abadi was a coup against the constitution .

nuri al-maliki ( 2nd r ) , acting defence minister saadoun al-dulaimi ( r ) and lieutenant general abboud qanbar ( c ) attend the funeral ceremony of gen. majid abdul salam at the defence ministry in baghdad august 13 , 2014 .

/iraq/reuters citing unnamed iraqi lawmakers , the new york times reported tuesday that maliki may be negotiating for a vice president slot in a new government : according to senior lawmakers , discussions have centered on offering mr. maliki the position of vice president , a ceremonial post that would come with immunities and a security detail and would allow him to remain in palatial government housing inside the fortified green zone .
as an alternative , iraqi officials have also begun quietly raising the question of whether mr. maliki should leave the country , and where he might go , according to a senior official .
the un maps the movement of internally displaced people and areas of fighting in iraq .
click through for a legible pdf version , which breaks down numbers of displaced people by governate .
the un counts 343,290 idps in anbar , 117,030 in irbil and 96,354 in dahuk .
clash areas extend as far south as kerbala .
unami ( @ uniraq ) new map - idps movement and clash areas map ( 13 august 2014 ) via @ twitterid @ twitterid # iraq

documents.title: khamenei : no talks with us except on nuclear issues
text: iran 's supreme leader ayatollah ali khamenei said on wednesday there there was no point in holding negotiations with the united states on issues outside the country 's nuclear program .
that ostensibly would preclude conversations on to such as the governmental transition in iraq .

reuters reports : there are no benefits in having relations or negotiations with the united states , except in certain specific cases , khamenei told a gathering of iranian diplomats , according to a statement on his website .
of course , on the nuclear front , talks will continue .
what ( foreign minister javad ) dr. zarif and his team started and has been going well until now , will continue , he said .
[ ] some people were under the impression that sitting down to talk with america would solve all our problems .
i knew that would n't be the case , but gave it a try due to the sensitive nature of the nuclear issue , he said .

european union foreign ministers will hold an emergency meeting on friday to discuss the conflicts in iraq and ukraine , the eu said on wednesday , reuters reports : eu foreign policy chief catherine ashton has decided to convene an extraordinary foreign affairs council this friday , 15 august , in brussels on the eu 's response to major ongoing crises , focusing on iraq and ukraine , a spokesman for ashton said

in addition to oil fields they have seized , fighters under the banner of an islamic state now control yet another powerful economic weapon : wheat supplies , reuters reports : fighters from the islamic state have overrun large areas in five of iraq 's most fertile provinces , where the united nations food agency says around 40 percent of its wheat is grown .
now they 're helping themselves to grain stored in government silos , milling it and distributing the flour on the local market , an iraqi official told reuters .
the islamic state has even tried to sell smuggled wheat back to the government to finance a war effort marked by extreme violence and brutality .
international officials are drawing uneasy comparisons with the days of hardship under dictator saddam hussein , when western sanctions led to serious shortages in the 1990s .
now is the worst time for food insecurity since the sanctions and things are getting worse , said fadel el-zubi , the u.n. food and agriculture organisation ( fao ) representative for iraq .
while iraq faces no immediate food shortages , the longer term outlook is deeply uncertain .
hassan nusayif al-tamimi , head of an independent nationwide union of farmers ' cooperatives , said the militants were intimidating any producers who tried to resist .
they are destroying crops and produce , and this is creating friction with the farmers .
they are placing farmers under a lot of pressure so that they can take their grain , he said , adding that farmers had reported fighters were also wrecking wells .
read the full piece here .

is fighters also have seized five oil fields , and pose a threat to others , including this field in sheikhan , near the kurdish city of dohuk : a taken on august 10 , 2014 shows a chimney at an oil field in sheikhan , northeast of the city of mosul in northern iraq and near the kurdish city of dohuk , an area where kurdish peshmerga forces are fighting to stop the advance of islamic state ( is ) fighters .
al-rubaye/afp/getty images

video : us deploys an additional 130 troops to iraq for humanitarian assessment ' the us defence secretary , chuck hagel , describes the extra us troop deployment in iraq as a temporary humanitarian mission .

the deployment 130 us troops arrived in the country on tuesday and will be tasked with assessing the scope of the humanitarian crisis facing thousands of displaced iraqi civilians trapped on mount sinjar , hagel says .
president barack obama has said repeatedly he will not send ground combat forces back into iraq .

caretaker iraqi prime minister nuri al-maliki ( c ) walks in the grounds of the defence ministry in the capital baghdad during the funeral of major general majid abdul salam , the pilot of a helicopter that crashed the day before in northern iraq , on august 13 , 2014 .
photograph : -/afp/getty images

the united states is likely to send accelerated shipments of missiles , guns and ammunition to iraq 's post-maliki government , guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) reported late tuesday , citing us officials : internal deliberations are said to continue within the obama administration over the details and scope of a defense aid package to a yet-unformed successor government led by haider al-abadi , who will inherit a country under assault from the army of the islamic state ( isis ) .
a state department official said the administration has been looking to see what we can accelerate , adding that much depends on the composition of a new iraqi government .

obama administration deliberations are said to draw short , for now , of expanding us air strikes against isis beyond the outskirts of irbil and mt sinjar , wherethousands of yazidis remain stranded .
it is also unlikely that planned shipments of f-16 fighter jets will greet abadi at the end of a 30-period mandated for the formation of a government .
read the full piece here .

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : iraqi prime minister nouri al-maliki returned to television wednesday to push back against the attempt to sweep him from office .
he said the naming of haider al-abadi as his successor was a violation of the constitution and had no value .
maliki said he had filed an objection in federal court to abadi 's appointment and that the country should abide by the court 's decision .
public support for maliki was lacking .
iran , shia militias , iraqi kurds , and leaders of his own dawa party had thrown their support to abadi .
france announced it would send arms to the iraqi kurds in their fight against sunni islamist militants .
separately , france said 900 of its citizens had traveled to the middle east to fight with the militants .

the us and uk continued to deliver assistance by helicopter and air drop to thousands of yazidis stranded in the sinjar mountains , but yazidis in camps protested that the aid was not enough and the crisis was only growing worse .
130 us troops arrived in iraq on tuesday on what the pentagon described as a temporary mission to assess the scope of the humanitarian crisis .
weapons that france is sending to the kurds may end up being used against french citizens fighting with the so-called islamic state .

france 's top security official says nearly 900 french citizens have gone to middle east battlegrounds and some have joined the islamic state group , the associated press reports : despite efforts to discourage french people from joining militant groups , the figures given wednesday by interior minister bernard cazeneuve show the numbers of french youth leaving continue to grow .
there are today nearly 900 from france who are part of this phenomenon , either in the theater of operations in syria or in iraq .

there are presumably some in iraq because the islamic state in iraq and the levant , which recruited them , takes them to all the places where it is engaged in combat , cazeneuve told france info radio .
security officials fear european militants will ultimately turn their skills against their homelands .

the guardian 's diplomatic editor , julian borger , rounds up the main developments in iraq so far today , including : france 's decision to arm the kurds , cameron 's return from holiday , and the continuing efforts to free yazidis pinned down by isis in the sinjar mountain .
britain can provide virtually nothing in practical military terms that is n't already being provided by the us , according to a new paper by the royal united services thinktank .
but the uk could still benefit from further involvement , it argues .

a uk role would serve three functions : an act of moral responsibility , recognising the british role in engendering iraqi instability after 2003 ; an act of burden sharing , for instance easing the strain on us pilots if the operational tempo were to quicken ; and third , visible support for the uk 's most significant diplomatic and military ally .
in addition , ministers might also consider the positive effect on british influence with a kurdish administration that could , in due course , form an independent state .
islamic state militants are taking wheat from state silos in northern and western iraq , an official told reuters .
hassan ibrahim , director general of the grain board of iraq , said the militants had seized wheat in recent weeks from government silos in the provinces of nineveh and anbar .

between 40,000 and 50,000 tonnes of the crop was taken from government silos in tal afar and sinjar in nineveh province , where hundreds of thousands of residents , many of them ethnic and religious minorities , have fled the militant onslaught .

militants seized a further 700 tonnes from storage sites in the western province of anbar in the past three weeks and took it across the border into islamic state-held areas in syria for milling , he said .
ibrahim said militants tried to sell wheat stolen from nineveh back to the government in other provinces .
for this reason i stopped purchasing wheat from farmers last thursday , he added .
a displaced iraqi boy from the yazidi community eats a piece of bread after cross the iraqi-syrian border at the fishkhabur crossing al-rubaye/afp/getty images
iran 's supreme leader ayatollah ali khamenei has confirmed his backing for iraq 's new prime minister haider al-abadi .
in a tweet , sent by his official account , he expressed hope that the new prime minister will solve iraq 's problems .
khamenei.ir ( @ khamenei ir ) about iraq ; as new pm is elected , god willing , problems will be solved & govt will give a good lesson to terrorists who seek sedition in # iraq .
iraq 's caretaker prime minister nouri al-maliki has again rejected abadi 's appointment , claiming it has no value .
britain should follow the lead of france and the us by arming the kurds , according to former defence secretary , liam fox .
interviewed on bbc radio 4 's world at one , fox also said britain should join the us in launching air strikes against isis .
he said : the humanitarian suffering and the security risks can not be dealt with by waiting or using humanitarian actions alone .
this is going to require some military intervention .
fox denied criticising david cameron specifically .
he said the west had generally been too slow to respond to the crisis in iraq .
but on britain 's role he said : we must not be seen as the reluctant ally .
fox added : the public are becoming increasingly horrified at what they are seeing in terms of the slaughter of civilians by isis .
britain 's most senior roman catholic , vincent nichols , has highlighting mounting christian concern about the plight of minorities in iraq in the face of isis persecution .
in a letter to the foreign secretary , cardinal nichols called for an increase in the humanitarian relief effort .

it said : i have followed the unfolding disaster in iraq with growing concern as both media reports and the testimony of iraqi christians illustrate the desperate threat posed by isis to many of iraqê¹s oldest communities .

christians and other religious minorities , above all the yazidi , now face destruction as in areas such as mosul , sinjar and qaraquosh that had previously been relatively protected britain has a role to play in that and i ask that you increase the existing efforts made by the foreign office to promote a culture in which the dignity of the person is paramount .
pope francis has renewed his appeal for international action to stop suffering among religious minorities in iraq .

in a letter to the un general secretary , he said : i write to you , mr secretary general , and place before you the tears , the suffering and the heartfelt cries of despair of christians and other religious minorities of the beloved land of iraq .
pope francis ( @ pontifex ) i thank all those who are courageously helping our brothers and sisters in iraq .
scores of yazidi survivors have stage protest demanding more aid , afp reports .
the demonstration occured at bajid kandala transit camp that is hosting thousands of desperate yazidis who fled a jihadist onslaught on sinjar .
we have no bread , and very little water .
we need help .
we want to get out of here .
we are so desperate we want to leave iraq , said nasser , a 30-year-old protester .
there is no un here , no human rights groups .
we have very little food .
the lucky ones get a meal a day .
many others go hungry , said khodhr hussein , a 44-year-old with dark wrinkled skin and a thick moustache .
many people are sleeping in the sun , the camp is not big enough for everybody , he said .
displaced iraqis from the yazidi community gather for food at the nowruz camp , in derike , syria mohammed/ap
here 's a summary of the latest developments : france has joined the us in pledging to arm kurdish forces fighting islamic militants in northern iraq .
the european union 's foreign policy chief , catherine ashton , has called an emergency meeting of foreign ministers to discuss the crisis .
david cameron has returned from holiday to chair a meeting of the government emergency committee on iraq .
the government repeated its refusal to recall parliament .
nouri al-maliki has rejected the appointment of haider al-abadi as his successor as prime minister .
maliki said the move was a violation of the constitution and had no value as his supporters gathered on the streets of baghdad .
iraq 's former speaker hajim al-hassani , a leading sunni politician , has urged his country to do much more than replace one shia prime minister with another .
he called for a federal system along sectarian lines .

britain is stepping up its involvement in iraq by flying military equipment on behalf of jordan to kurdish forces fighting islamic state jihadists in northern iraq and dispatching a fleet of chinook helicopters to airlift yazidi refugees besieged on mount sinjar .
the move comes amid growing pressure on david cameron to launch military strikes against the extremists , as the former thatcher ally conor burns warned that isis forces want a holocaust .
another 130 us troops have arrived in iraq on what the pentagon described as a temporary mission to assess the scope of the humanitarian crisis .

the defence secretary , chuck hagel , announced the deployment in remarks to marines at the camp pendleton base in southern california , on the final stop of a week-long , around-the-world trip that also took him to india , germany and australia .
the uk and us have carried out more humanitarian air drops to help yazidis besieged by islamic state militants .
britain 's development secretary , justine greening , confirmed britain 's third air drop , while the us carried out its sixth .
the kurdish security chief masrour barzani pleaded with britain to rally to the help of the kurds , citing britain 's historic role in the region .
he warned that failure to do so was certain to amplify the terror threat at home .
in an interview with the guardian , he said : in terms of drawing the lines [ the regional borders ] , the uk had the greatest role in the creation of the modern middle east .
now is not the time to say it is not our problem .
i would like britain to remember that we are not helmand , or basra ; we are your friends .
more on france 's decision to supply arms to the kurds .

the statement from hollande 's office added : france intends to play an active role by providing , along with its partners and in liaison with the new iraqi authorities , all the assistance required .
hollande also reiterated france 's support for iraq 's premier designate , haidar al-abadi , and urged a unity government , representing all iraqis to fight effectively against islamic state .
senior american officials say the cia is directly arming the kurds in their fight against islamic state militants .
on sunday france 's foreign minister , laurent fabius , travelled to irbil to deliver an initial shipment of aid .
he also held talks with iraq 's kurdish president , foud massoum .
iraq 's newly-elected president fouad massoum met french foreign affairs minister laurent fabius on monday .
al-sudani/ap
germany 's foreign minister , frank-walter steinmeier , has pledged to go to the limits of what is politically and legally possible to help iraq .
germanforeignoffice ( @ germanydiplo ) fm # steinmeier on the situation in # iraq : humanitarian aid is a matter of course - but we must look whether we can and must do more .
1/2 germanforeignoffice ( @ germanydiplo ) fm # steinmeier cont 'd : in light of the dramatic situation , i favour going to the limits of what is politically+legally possible .
# iraq 2/2 germany has already pledged non-lethal military aid to iraq .
the office of the french president , franã§ois hollande , has said france will supply arms in coming hours in response to requests from kurds .
in a statement it said : to meet the urgent needs voiced by the kurdish regional authorities , the head of state [ hollande ] decided in liaison with baghdad to ship arms in the coming hours .
the move , which follows a similar commitment from the us , will put pressure on other eu countries to do the same .
the eu 's foreign policy chief , catherine ashton , has called for a special meeting of foreign ministers on iraq .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : france announces it will send weapons to iraq 'in coming hours ' with baghdad 's agreement .

documents.title: maliki rejects appointment of new pm
text: as most observers predicted , nouri al-maliki is not going quietly .
he has just rejected the appointment of haider al-abadi as his successor as prime minister , reuters reports .
almost two days after abadi was appointed as pm designate , maliki said the move was a violation of the constitution and had no value .
in a televised speech , maliki said everyone should accept a federal court ruling on an objection he filed against abadi 's appointment .
on tuesday maliki ordered his security forces not to resist the appointment of abadi .
iraqi officials have also begun raising the question of whether maliki should leave the country , according to the new york times .
there have been unconfirmed reports that iran is willing to offer him asylum .
supporters of maliki demonstrate in baghdad on wednesday .
tanks and humvees were positioned on baghdad bridges and at major intersections , with security personnel more visible than usual .
kadim/ap

documents.title: cameron returns to uk
text: david cameron is back from his family holiday in portugal and will chair today 's meeting of the government 's emergency committee on iraq , no 10 has announced .
uk prime minister ( @ number10gov ) the pm is now back in the uk and will chair the routine daily cobr at 13:00 for latest updates on situation in iraq
the british government has repeated its rejection of calls to recall parliament to discuss the iraq crisis .

speaking to sky news , the work and pensions secretary , iain duncan smith , said the government had made it pretty clear there was no justification for a recall at present as nothing has changed from what we said we were going to do .
calls for a recall are a cry of frustration , according to the guardian 's rafael behr .
why bring mps back ?
the argument appears to be that when events stir the public conscience and the men in khaki are on high alert , westminster simply must express itself .
even if no one offers anything workable to be done , there are plenty of things to be said ¦ everyone else is having their say , on television , on facebook , on twitter .
the pace and tone of national debate is set by the most urgent polemicists , not the most informed commentators .
the day has gone when the house of commons was an apex of authority whose wisdom cascaded through a few channels into the public realm .
opinion-formation has been liberalised at an explosive rate , and mps are disoriented by the competition .
iraq 's trauma is not reduced if the prime minister truncates his holiday , but the febrile ethos of an always-on news culture judges him negligent for staying away .
the islamic state has gained ground around aleppo in neighbouring syria , according to unconfirmed reports .
the british-based monitoring group the syrian observatory for human rights said the militant group had seized the towns of turkmen bareh and akhtarin , 30 miles ( 50km ) north-east of aleppo .

reuters adds : diplomats and rebels said the syrian government , which is fighting rebels across the country , had launched attacks on towns run by the group only after its militants had advanced into neighbouring iraq and seized a third of its territories .
islamic state is tightening its grip over areas of syria under its control , including the city of raqqa on the euphrates river .
raqqa has become islamic state 's syrian power base .

the observatory , which uses a network of monitors , reported battles between islamic state fighters and syrian government forces near a raqqa military airport , the government 's last remaining position in the area .

the observatory also reported two more crucifixions by islamic state in deir al-zor overnight , bringing to 27 the number of people executed by the group in recent days as it tightens it grip over the eastern province .
three journalists were among the injured when a helicopter delivering aid to refugees crashed in the mountains of northern iraq , killing the pilot , writes roy greenslade .
they were moises saman , a magnum agency photographer working for time magazine , the new york times 's correspondent , alissa rubin , and its photographer , adam ferguson .
they suffered minor injuries and saman was able to take of the incident .

speaking afterwards to a time editor by phone , saman said the helicopter had crashed soon after taking off , having rescued several yazidis who had spent days sheltering from the islamic militants of isis .
labour has broadly backed the government 's approach to the crisis in iraq , by supporting us air strikes but stopping short of calling for uk military intervention .
the shadow foreign secretary , douglas alexander , said the us had unique military capabilities to help avert a massacre of yazidis trapped on the sinjar mountains .

in a statement he said : president obama was right to authorise targeted us air strikes to prevent the further slaughter of these vulnerable civilians , and to support the humanitarian air drops of vital food , water , and medicine .
the iraqi government has asked for international help .
the un security council has urged the world to act , and the united states has unique military capabilities to help avert a massacre .
clearly the uk must now also be doing all that we can to assist the vital humanitarian effort that is now under way to help save lives and prevent further suffering .
labour has welcomed the uk 's provision of humanitarian support for iraq to date , including the use of military assets to assist with the delivery of humanitarian supplies .
the government should be working actively with our allies to now step up the humanitarian response to the unfolding tragedy on mount sinjar .
that should include looking at how the united kingdom can contribute most effectively , including the use of military assets to deliver supplies .
our task is to make our contribution and support the work required to save lives and secure the safety of these vulnerable people .
the shadow foreign secretary , douglas alexander .
macleod
egypt 's top cleric has condemned the islamic state , describing it as a terrorist organisation that poses a danger to islam and muslims .

grand mufti shawki allam , egypt 's highest religious authority , said the extremist group was violating all the islamic principles and the intentions of the sharia [ islamic law ] , ap reports , citing egypt 's news agency .
the statement comes after the vatican urged muslim leaders to condemn isis .

britain 's development secretary , justine greening , appears to be trying to give the impression that the uk humanitarian relief operation is keeping pace with the americans by using a different way of counting what constitutes an air drop .
her twitter feed said there had now been five uk air drops .
her department 's press release makes it clear that there have been three rounds of air drops , including drops from two separate planes last night .
justine greening ( @ justinegreening ) there have now been five successful air drops to northern # iraq .
british aid is getting through to people in need the us says it has made six air drops , but these include drops from more than one plane during each round .
last night 's us round included drops from four separate planes .
no 10 continues to use the us way of counting air drops .
in a statement it said : three uk aid drops have now taken place , with two c-130s delivering 3180 re-usable water containers , filled with a total of 15,900 litres of clean water .
the washington post has a helpful graphic that helps explain the plight of yazidi people trapped in the sinjar mountains and the efforts to help them .
washington post ( @ washingtonpost ) u.s. bombing intensifies to save civilians trapped on the mountain
iraq 's former speaker hajim al-hassani , a leading sunni politician , has urged his country to do much more than replace one shia prime minister with another .
speaking to bbc radio 4 's today programme he called for a federal system along sectarian lines .
hassani expressed backing for iraq 's new prime minister haidar al-abadi .
he said abadi understood the need for a new inclusive government in iraq .
he said : that was the reason he switched sides he was a very close ally of maliki .
when we see such a big move , that means he realised things will not get better unless we see some kind of compromises between all the three components of iraqi society .
but he urged iraq to go further .
the issue is not changing maliki with another person .
i think we have much deeper issues .

we have to look into the iraqi political process itself ¦ if the people want to establish a federal state the choice is for the people , not for those who are running the government ¦ right now that 's the only way to keep iraq unified .
hassani accused maliki of taking iraq down the path of dictatorship .
and he warned that iraq faced bloodshed on the scale of neighbouring syria without reconciliation at a national level .
iraq 's former speaker hajim al-hassani .
/getty images
britain 's international development department has released more details about last night 's round of humanitarian air drops .
the supplies dropped over mount sinjar came in two separate consignments , bringing the total number of british air drops to five in three separate rounds .
they included 2,640 reusable water purification containers filled with clean water and 528 shelter kits .

the international development secretary , justine greening , said : as thousands of iraqi people remain cut off away from their homes , we are focused on getting help to those in need , particularly those trapped on mount sinjar .
after last night the raf have successfully made five drops , including thousands of containers filled with clean water that can also be used to purify dirty water and hundreds of shelter kits .
the royal air force hercules c-130j aircraft from raf brize norton in oxfordshire england before conducting an air drop over northern iraq .
/ministry of defence
australia 's prime minister , tony abbott , has refused to rule out military action in iraq .
he said there was a potential genocide under way in the country and australia was ready to protect people from murder .
later australia 's defence minister , david johnston , said he did not want to get into a rule-in rule-out guarantee game on the possibility of sending troops into iraq , daniel hurst reports .

but when asked about definitive statements by american leaders that the us would not deploy its combat forces to the region , johnston acknowledged that it was very reasonable to conclude australia would not do so either .
britain 's sun newspaper is beating the drum for more military involvement in iraq .
sun politics ( @ sun politics ) on what we should do in iraq , the sun says
a suicide bomber has attacked a checkpoint near the home of iraq 's new prime minister , haider al-abadi , in baghdad , reuters reports , citing local media and police sources .
the suicide bomber blew himself up at a checkpoint that leads to the prime minister 's house , one of the police sources said .
there were no word of casualties .
officials in abadi 's office were not immediately available for comment on the attack .
one official said : we are in a meeting .
haider al-abadi speaks to the press after an iraqi parliament session .
kadim/ap
welcome to our live coverage of the continuing humanitarian , political , and military crisis in iraq .

here 's a roundup of the latest developments : britain is stepping up its involvement in iraq by flying military equipment on behalf of jordan to kurdish forces fighting islamic state jihadists in northern iraq and dispatching a fleet of chinook helicopters to airlift yazidi refugees besieged on mount sinjar .
the move comes amid growing pressure on david cameron to launch military strikes against the extremists , as the former thatcher ally conor burns warned that isis forces want a holocaust .
another 130 us troops have arrived in iraq on what the pentagon described as a temporary mission to assess the scope of the humanitarian crisis .

the defence secretary , chuck hagel , announced the deployment in remarks to marines at the camp pendleton base in southern california , on the final stop of a week-long , around-the-world trip that also took him to india , germany and australia .
the uk and us have carried out more humanitarian air drops to help yazidis besieged by islamic state militants .
britain 's development secretary , justine greening , confirmed britain 's third air drop , while the us carried out its sixth .
the kurdish security chief masrour barzani pleaded with britain to rally to the help of the kurds , citing britain 's historic role in the region .
he warned that failure to do so was certain to amplify the terror threat at home .
in an interview with the guardian , he said : in terms of drawing the lines [ the regional borders ] , the uk had the greatest role in the creation of the modern middle east .
now is not the time to say it is not our problem .
i would like britain to remember that we are not helmand , or basra ; we are your friends .
iran has turned its back on nouri al-maliki and congratulated his designated successor haider al-abadi , paving the way for maliki 's removal from power .

the move by maliki 's main sponsor , which was signalled by a senior official close to iran 's supreme leader , aligned tehran with the us , saudi arabia and nato in formally backing haider al-abadi as the new premier apparently making maliki 's position untenable .

the vatican has called on muslim leaders to denounce unambiguously the persecution of christians and yazidis in iraq and hinted that it is considering breaking off dialogue with islamic representatives if they fail to do so .

in a statement , the department in charge of inter-religious dialogue said : the dramatic situation of the christians , the yazidis , and other minority religious and ethnic communities in iraq demands that religious leaders , and above all muslim religious leaders , people engaged in inter-religious dialogue and all people of good will take a clear and courageous stance .
col tim collins , one of britain 's most respected commanders , has compared the massacres in iraq with genocides carried out by joseph stalin and pol pot .
in an interview with telegraph he said britain 's politicians had left for lunch and joined others in urging david cameron to recall parliament to debate the crisis .
the un secretary general , ban ki-moon , has urged the international community to do more to help the yazidi minority in iraq , as the poison of hatred and brutality continues to spread .

he said the plight of the yazidi people , thousands of whom are still trapped in the sinjar mountains , was harrowing , with accounts of executions , child abductions and exploitation at the hands of isis militants .

bulletin.text: Marines and special forces land on Mt Sinjar.
British SAS soldiers deployed in area.
France, UK, Germany join effort to arm Kurds.
Maliki again rejects legitimacy of designated successor.
